answers.author: Mark Pfaffinger
answers.text:
Larimer County has been using Google Apps for Government for about one year.  We would be happy to discuss the benefits and limitations of Cloud computing using the Google platform for email, calendar and document sharing.  In addition, we do outsource to "cloud" providers a number of other software services such as applicant tracking to NeoGov with much success.  The main benefit for us has been the reduced IT support costs and the move to a platform that is very open and available to our users and opened up many more options for mobile computing.  
-Mark Pfaffinger
Larimer County
970-498-5050

answers.text:
Hola a todos,
Resido en un pequeño pueblo de Spain y vamos a comenzar a usar Google Apps para aprovechar los beneficios del trabajo en la nube, pero al mismo tiempo, estamos mirando para que esa nueva forma de trabajo sirva para otra línea de trabajo que estamos siguiendo que es la de Open Goverment. Sabéis donde podría ver las sinergias que se pueden llevar a cabo?
Gracias.

author: Rachel Leininger
text:
Our city is currently in the process of mapping out a new IT strategic plan.  We are using Google Apps Cloud computing for a free 30 day trial to see how that option will work within our organization.  Though the Cloud computing sees like a really great solution to many of our IT needs, we are still slightly concerned about about security and some of the limitiations invloved.  Has anyone had experience using Cloud computing?  If so what company/software did you use?  Any suggestions would be helpful as we do not have a IT person on staff.
Thanks in advance!!
Rachel
title: Computing in the Cloud
